title: Leolux23
author: Leolux23
content: Hi, I am trying to install Electrum 4.4.3 and to check the GPG signature of the soft (for OS), so GPGSuite shows me that the installer file is signed by Stephan Oeste it@oeste.de, but in the verification guide https://bitzuma.com/posts/how-to-verify-an-electrum-download-on-mac/   it is written that the file should be signed by Thomas Voegtlin. Could you please help, if the developers added one more person to sign the wallet download file?

comments.author: Leolux23
comments.body: cleared the question by myself. please, put the topic off-line. thanks

comments.author: janbak72
comments.body: I've the same issue ... but I was not able to clarify on myself, can you help me please?

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Electrum binary files are being signed by three different developers as of the last year or so.  Check this guide for more information:[GUIDE] How to Safely Download and Verify Electrum [Guide]The developers' GPG signing keys can be found here: https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum/tree/master/pubkeysThe three developers signing current releases are Thomas Voegtlin (ThomasV,) Steven Oeste (Emzy,) and SomberNight/ghost43.

comments.author: janbak72
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on May 16, 2023, 09:21:44 PMElectrum binary files are being signed by three different developers as of the last year or so.  Check this guide for more information:[GUIDE] How to Safely Download and Verify Electrum [Guide]The developers' GPG signing keys can be found here: https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum/tree/master/pubkeysThe three developers signing current releases are Thomas Voegtlin (ThomasV,) Steven Oeste (Emzy,) and SomberNight/ghost43.Thank you so much, that's crystal clear now
